prompt: <description>**Part 1 - Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Next, create a new sketch on the X-Y plane. Draw a rectangle with four straight lines. The dimensions for this rectangle are as follows: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.24] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.24], End Point [0.0, 0.24] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.24], End Point [0.0, 0.0] After drawing the rectangle, create a circular arc. The arc should start at the end of line 4, end at the start of line 1, and pass through the midpoint of line 1 and line 4. This will create a curved side for the rectangular prism. Close the loop to ensure a closed profile. Scale the 2D sketch uniformly by a factor of 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch onto the Z-axis with a rotation of 0 degrees around the X and Y axes and a translation of 0 on all axes. Extrude the scaled and transformed sketch along the Z-axis by 0.18 units, which results in a 3D model with the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.18 units **Part 2 - Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector set to [0.03, 0.0, 0.0458]. Create a new sketch on the X-Z plane. Draw a rectangle with four straight lines. The dimensions for this rectangle are as follows: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.195, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.195, 0.0], End Point [0.195, 0.0885] - Line 3: Start Point [0.195, 0.0885], End Point [0.0, 0.0885] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0885], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop to ensure a closed profile. Scale the 2D sketch uniformly by a factor of 0.195. Transform the 2D sketch onto the Y-axis with a rotation of 0 degrees around the X and Z axes and a translation of 0 on all axes. Perform a cut operation (instead of adding material) the length, width, and height of the 3D model derived from the scaled and transformed sketch should be 0.195 units. This results in a 3D model being subtracted from the previously created rectangular prism with a curved side, producing a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom and a reduced height.</description>
